ISSUE.TITLE: [bug]: Error 401 after updating to 0.13
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Is there an existing issue for this? - [X] I have searched the existing issues ### Current behavior After updating to version 0.13 and adjusting the docker compose file to the new schema, I see this error in my console and can't login anymore: ![image](https://github.com/makeplane/plane/assets/1368405/7cff320e-a751-4486-bd18-15f1687abf9c) Here is my compose file: ```yml version: '3.8' services: web: image: makeplane/plane-frontend container_name: web restart: always command: /usr/local/bin/start.sh web/server.js web env_file: - ~/files/env/web.env depends_on: - api - worker space: image: makeplane/plane-space container_name: space restart: always command: /usr/local/bin/start.sh space/server.js space env_file: - ~/files/env/space.env depends_on: - api - worker - web api: image: makeplane/plane-backend container_name: api restart: always command: ./bin/takeoff env_file: - ~/files/env/api.env depends_on: - plane-db - plane-redis worker: image: makeplane/plane-backend container_name: worker restart: always command: ./bin/worker env_file: - ~/files/env/api.env depends_on: - api - plane-db - plane-redis beat-worker: image: makeplane/plane-backend container_name: beat-worker restart: always command: ./bin/beat env_file: - ~/files/env/api.env depends_on: - api - plane-db - plane-redis plane-db: image: postgres:15.2-alpine container_name: plane-db restart: always command: postgres -c 'max_connections=1000' env_file: - .env environment: POSTGRES_USER: ${PGUSER} POSTGRES_DB: ${PGDATABASE} POSTGRES_PASSWORD: ${PGPASSWORD} PGDATA: /var/lib/postgresql/data volumes: - ~/files/db:/var/lib/postgresql/data plane-redis: image: redis:6.2.7-alpine container_name: plane-redis restart: always volumes: - ~/files/redis:/data plane-minio: image: minio/minio container_name: plane-minio restart: always volumes: - ~/files/minio:/export env_file: - .env environment: MINIO_ROOT_USER: ${AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID} MINIO_ROOT_PASSWORD: ${AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY} command: server /export --console-address ":9090" createbuckets: image: minio/mc env_file: - .env depends_on: - plane-minio entrypoint: > /bin/sh -c " /usr/bin/mc config host add plane-minio http://plane-minio:9000 \$AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID \$AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY; /usr/bin/mc mb plane-minio/\$AWS_S3_BUCKET_NAME; /usr/bin/mc anonymous set download plane-minio/\$AWS_S3_BUCKET_NAME; exit 0; " proxy: image: makeplane/plane-proxy container_name: proxy restart: always ports: - ${NGINX_PORT}:80 env_file: - .env environment: FILE_SIZE_LIMIT: ${FILE_SIZE_LIMIT:-5242880} BUCKET_NAME: ${AWS_S3_BUCKET_NAME:-uploads} depends_on: - web - api - space ``` I also created the .env files according to the ones here on github. I'm not sure how to debug this error. This is the log of the api server: ``` [2023-09-29 20:31:52 +0000] [16] [INFO] Started server process [16] [2023-09-29 20:31:52 +0000] [16] [INFO] Waiting for application startup. [2023-09-29 20:31:52 +0000] [16] [INFO] ASGI 'lifespan' protocol appears unsupported. [2023-09-29 20:31:52 +0000] [16] [INFO] Application startup complete. [2023-09-29 20:31:52 +0000] [17] [INFO] Started server process [17] [2023-09-29 20:31:52 +0000] [17] [INFO] Waiting for application startup. [2023-09-29 20:31:52 +0000] [17] [INFO] ASGI 'lifespan' protocol appears unsupported. [2023-09-29 20:31:52 +0000] [17] [INFO] Application startup complete. 172.18.0.10:52438 - "GET /api/users/me/ HTTP/1.0" 401 172.18.0.10:52442 - "GET /api/users/me/ HTTP/1.0" 401 172.18.0.10:52452 - "GET /api/users/me/ HTTP/1.0" 401 172.18.0.10:34166 - "GET /api/users/me/ HTTP/1.0" 401 172.18.0.10:47386 - "GET /api/users/me/ HTTP/1.0" 401 172.18.0.10:50562 - "GET /api/users/me/ HTTP/1.0" 401 172.18.0.10:57628 - "GET /api/users/me/ HTTP/1.0" 401 172.18.0.10:55662 - "GET /api/users/me/ HTTP/1.0" 401 172.18.0.10:55678 - "GET /api/users/me/ HTTP/1.0" 401 172.18.0.10:55692 - "GET /api/users/me/ HTTP/1.0" 401 172.18.0.10:55700 - "GET /api/users/me/ HTTP/1.0" 401 172.18.0.10:55714 - "GET /api/users/me/ HTTP/1.0" 401 172.18.0.10:55724 - "POST /api/sign-in/ HTTP/1.0" 200 172.18.0.10:55730 - "GET /api/users/me/ HTTP/1.0" 401 172.18.0.10:55746 - "GET /api/users/me/ HTTP/1.0" 401 ``` ### Steps to reproduce 1. Update from 0.12 to 0.13 2. Change docker compose file ### Browser Google Chrome ### Version Self-hosted
